results.code:
102 
103 def setup_oauth_mock(
104     client,
105     host,
106     access_token_path,
107     user_path=None,
108     token_type='Bearer',
109     token_request_style='post',
110     scope="",
111 ):
112     """setup the mock client for OAuth
113 
114     generates and registers two handlers common to OAuthenticators:
115 
116     - create the access token (POST access_token_path)
117     - get the user info (GET user_path)
118 
119 
120     and adds a method for creating a new mock handler to pass to .authenticate():
121 
122     client.handler_for_user(user)
123 
124     where user is the user-model to be returned by the user request.
125 
126     Args:
127 
128         host (str): the host to mock (e.g. api.github.com)
129         access_token_path (str): The path for the access token request (e.g. /access_token)
130         user_path (str): The path for requesting  (e.g. /user)
131         token_type (str): the token_type field for the provider
132         scope (str): The scope field returned by the provider
133     """
134 
135     client.oauth_codes = oauth_codes = {}
136     client.access_tokens = access_tokens = {}
137 
138     def access_token(request):
139         """Handler for access token endpoint
140 
141         Checks code and allocates a new token.
142         Replies with JSON model for the token.
143         """
144         assert request.method == 'POST', request.method
145         query = urlparse(request.url).query
146         if not query:
147             query = request.body.decode('utf8')
148         query = parse_qs(query)
149         if 'code' not in query:
150             return HTTPResponse(
151                 request=request,
152                 code=400,
153                 reason=f"No code in access token request: url={request.url}, body={request.body}",
154             )
155         code = query['code'][0]
156         if code not in oauth_codes:
157             return HTTPResponse(
158                 request=request, code=403, reason=f"No such code: {code}"
159             )
160 
161         # consume code, allocate token
162         token = uuid.uuid4().hex
163         user = oauth_codes.pop(code)
164         access_tokens[token] = user
165         model = {
166             'access_token': token,
167             'token_type': token_type,
168         }
169         if scope:
170             model['scope'] = scope
171         if 'id_token' in user:
172             model['id_token'] = user['id_token']
173         return model
174 
175     def get_user(request):
176         assert request.method == 'GET', request.method
177         auth_header = request.headers.get('Authorization')
178         if auth_header:
179             token = auth_header.split(None, 1)[1]
180         else:
181             query = parse_qs(urlparse(request.url).query)
182 
183             if 'access_token' in query:
184                 token = query['access_token'][0]
185             else:
186                 return HTTPResponse(
187                     request=request,
188                     code=403,
189                     reason='Missing Authorization header',
190                 )
191         if token not in access_tokens:
192             return HTTPResponse(
193                 request=request,
194                 code=403,
195                 reason='No such access token: %r' % token,
196             )
197         return access_tokens.get(token)
198 
199     if isinstance(host, str):
200         hosts = [host]
201     else:
202         hosts = host
203     for host in hosts:
204         client.add_host(
205             host,
206             [
207                 (access_token_path, access_token),
208                 (user_path, get_user),
209             ],
210         )
211 
212     def handler_for_user(user):
213         """Return a new mock RequestHandler
214 
215         user should be the JSONable model that will ultimately be returned
216         from the get_user request.
217         """
218         code = uuid.uuid4().hex
219         oauth_codes[code] = user
220         handler = Mock(spec=web.RequestHandler)
221         handler.find_user = Mock(return_value=None)
222         handler.get_argument = Mock(return_value=code)
223         handler.request = HTTPServerRequest(
224             method="GET", uri=f"https://hub.example.com?code={code}"
225         )
226         handler.hub = Mock(server=Mock(base_url='/hub/'), base_url='/hub/')
227         handler.get_state_cookie = Mock(
228             return_value=_serialize_state(
229                 {"state_id": "123", "next_url": "/ABC", "code_verifier": "123"}
230             )
231         )
232         return handler
233 
234     client.handler_for_user = handler_for_user
235
results.issue_text: Possible hardcoded password: 'Bearer'
